intro: Rohria armata, commonly known as the mountain rohria, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and well-drained soils, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, while its flowers are usually pink or white, adding a delicate touch to the alpine landscape. Rohria armata is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in the ecological balance of its native habitat.
